column4: Is there any way to apply the ubuntu patches to a vanilla kernel?
Lo.
Easy Ubuntu
Automatix is dangerous. Well it can be
so can gparted
What exactly does gparted have to do with Easy ubuntu/Automatix.
you said automatix is dangerous
so is gparted
have you looked at the source lately?
So can skiing down a mountain backwards nakid, but that never came into the convo, So why gparted?
automatix isnt any more dangerous than gparted
no but when theres a safer option, why not use it. Personally i dont use either but if someone wants to...

i dont use either myself but automatix code has changed alot the only one we support in this channel is do it yourself. but false info is not a good thing. definitly on a subject so flamable hence why the factoid for it changed
False info? I dont use either so im not qualified to comment really as i said, but im just passing on info that has been on varius forums/mailing lists plenty of times.
automatix is as unsafe as using a 3rd party repo
it backs up anything it over writes you cant figure out how to use the backups thats not automatix fault
what is your question
no worries, its sorted
ok
we only _need_ to say it once
